intro: Ouratea septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, spherical fruits. Ouratea septentrionalis is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and understory habitats.
